intro: Wedelia pauciflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf wedelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
